title: Get Gholdengo in Pokemon Scarlet and Violet: A Simple Guide

steps.title: Find some ruins in Paldea.
steps.content: Find some ruins in Paldea. Gimmighoul frequents areas like watchtowers and ruins in their chest form. Some areas include South Province, East Province, West Province, North Province, Glaseado Mountain, Casseroya Lake, and Asado Desert. [1] X Research source If you find Gimmighoul not in a chest, you can only capture it using Pokémon Go. You cannot capture a wandering Gimmighoul in Pokémon Scarlet and Violet.

steps.title: Interact with the chest.
steps.content: Interact with the chest. Once you see a chest, go up to it and interact with it. If it's a Gimmighoul, the battle will commence so you can capture it!

steps.title: Capture Gimmighoul.
steps.content: Capture Gimmighoul. You can't damage this Pokémon with any type of attack. All you can do is capture it. It will attack you back, but its attacks do low damage, so you'll want to use a Pokémon with a good health pool.

steps.title: Get 999 Gimmighoul coins.
steps.content: Get 999 Gimmighoul coins. That may seem like a lot at first glance, but you get Gimmighoul coins every time you defeat a Gimmighoul and by talking to wandering Gimmighouls. Go to the areas where you previously looked, and Gimmighoul will respawn after some time, so you can endlessly farm for those coins. [2] X Research source Tip: When you see a Gimmighoul chest, save your game immediately. This way, you can perform a soft reset (turn the game off, then back on) and battle the Gimmighoul chest for more coins. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Level up your Gimmighoul and watch it evolve.
steps.content: Level up your Gimmighoul and watch it evolve. Once you have the 999 Gimmighoul Coins, you can level your Pokémon! It'll evolve into Gholdengo once it levels up (to level 38), and you have 999 Gimmighoul Coins in your bag. You will lose those coins as Gimmighoul evolves.
